alert.note: Alert for Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 5:24PM MST until August 24 at 7:45PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR HOLBROOK AND JOSEPH CITY UNTIL 715 PM MST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Arizona, including the following county, Navajo. * WHEN...Until 715 PM MST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in creeks and normally dry washes is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 522 PM MST, the public reported minor street flooding in downtown Holbrook. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... McDonald Canyon, Mesa Wash, Digger Wash, Porter Tank Draw, Manila Wash, Fivemile Wash, Leroux Wash, Blairs Spring Wash, Billy Wash, Cottonwood Wash, Puerco River, Little Lithodendron Wash, West Twin Wash, Tanner Wash, Little Colorado River, East Twin Wash and Joseph City Wash. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Holbrook, Joseph City and Sun Valley. - This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 269 and 299. Business Interstate 40 between mile markers 275 and 289. State Route 377 between mile markers 22 and 33. State Route 77 between mile markers 384 and 404. Highway 180 between mile markers 308 and 311. - Visit www.weather.gov/safety/flood for more information on flood safety.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly or mountainous terrain, there are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
